channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The NFL is removing 'End Racism' from its Super Bowl end zone
item.description: Here's what the decision by America's favorite sports league tells us about "anticipatory obedience."
item.content:encoded:
Here's what the decision by America's favorite sports league tells us about "anticipatory obedience."

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Gene Demby

item.title: These researchers have found a scientifically perfect way to cook eggs
item.description: An Italian study published this week has found the way to cook a perfect egg — you'll just need to spend 32 minutes to make it happen.
item.content:encoded:
An Italian study published this week has found the way to cook a perfect egg — you'll just need to spend 32 minutes to make it happen.

(Image credit: Veni vidi... shoot)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Americans are expected to place more than $1 billion in Super Bowl bets
item.description: Americans are expected to gamble more than $1 billion for Sunday's Super Bowl, according to the American Gaming Association.
item.content:encoded:
Americans are expected to gamble more than $1 billion for Sunday's Super Bowl, according to the American Gaming Association.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump's executive actions are getting challenged as 'arbitrary.' What does that mean?
item.description: At the center of legal challenges against Trump's executive actions is whether he's telling federal agencies to violate a key legal standard established nearly 80 years ago.
item.content:encoded:
At the center of legal challenges against Trump's executive actions is whether he's telling federal agencies to violate a key legal standard established nearly 80 years ago.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Christina Gatti

item.title: Trump supporters welcome the first steps in his immigration crackdown
item.description: President Trump kicked off his second term with a dramatic crackdown on immigration. Critics call those moves cruel and unnecessary. But many of Trump's supporters are applauding these early steps.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump kicked off his second term with a dramatic crackdown on immigration. Critics call those moves cruel and unnecessary. But many of Trump's supporters are applauding these early steps.

(Image credit: Leah Millis)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Linda McMahon led WWE and the SBA. The U.S. Education Dept. may be next
item.description: McMahon has a limited background in education, and a long career as a business executive. She'd be stepping into an agency the president hopes to dissolve.
item.content:encoded:
McMahon has a limited background in education, and a long career as a business executive. She'd be stepping into an agency the president hopes to dissolve.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: 3 Israeli hostages freed for Palestinian detainees and prisoners
item.description: The exchanges are part of a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
The exchanges are part of a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas.

(Image credit: Hostages and Missing Families Forum)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Federal judge blocks DOGE from accessing sensitive U.S. Treasury Department material
item.description: The case, filed in federal court in New York City, alleges the Trump administration allowed Musk's team access to the Treasury Department's central payment system in violation of federal law.
item.content:encoded:
The case, filed in federal court in New York City, alleges the Trump administration allowed Musk's team access to the Treasury Department's central payment system in violation of federal law.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump plans to name himself chair of Kennedy Center, fire board members
item.description: The president announced Friday that he would remove multiple board members, including the Chairman, who do not share his vision for a "Golden Age in Arts and Culture."
item.content:encoded:
The president announced Friday that he would remove multiple board members, including the Chairman, who do not share his vision for a "Golden Age in Arts and Culture."

(Image credit: Hulton Archive)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: How conspiracy theories about Politico led Trump to cancel subscriptions
item.description: Less than 24 hours after misleading claims started circulating that tied Politico to USAID, the White House vowed to end subscriptions for the insider news outlet's services and others.
item.content:encoded:
Less than 24 hours after misleading claims started circulating that tied Politico to USAID, the White House vowed to end subscriptions for the insider news outlet's services and others.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan
